bestBHT.bht: The point lies in doing it before men, as one must do it despising the shame. The Lord holds Himself bound to repay it in kind by confessing the individual before the angels of God. This act of confession before the angels will occur on the day of judgment. By openly avowing the Gospel without hypocrisy, one will receive the acknowledgment and recognition of the Lord as a true follower of Christ.

bhtAttempts.bht: The significance lies in openly confessing one's faith in Christ before others. Despite the potential shame and rejection, taking this step is rewarded by the Lord Himself acknowledging and confessing such individuals before the angels of God. This confession before the angels will take place on the day of judgment, where true followers of Christ will be recognized and honored.

The point of Luke 12:8 is in confessing one's faith in Christ openly before others, even in the face of shame. By doing so, the Lord is bound to repay this act by confessing them before the angels of God. This confession will take place on the day of judgment, where true followers of Christ will be recognized and acknowledged. The confession before the angels serves as a testament to their authenticity and the worthiness of their faith.

The importance lies in openly confessing one's faith in Christ before others, disregarding any potential shame. This act of confession is rewarded by the Lord, who promises to acknowledge and confess such individuals before the angels of God. The confession before the angels serves as a testament to the authenticity of one's faith and will take place on the day of judgment. This recognition of true followers of Christ underscores the significance of openly avowing the Gospel without hypocrisy.
